newsitem.title: FRANCE: Lyonnaise, Suez clinched merger deal.
newsitem.headline: Lyonnaise, Suez clinched merger deal.

text.p: Lyonnaise des Eaux and Cie de Suez on Friday agreed a merger deal, which would create a strong European utilities group, Suez chairman Gerard Mestrallet told reportes.
The merger will take the form of a swap of 20 Lyonnaise shares for 41 Suez shares.
The new Suez Lyonnaise des Eaux group sees a return on invested capital of at least 10 percent, Lyonnaise des Eaux chairman Jerome Monod told journalists.
In a statement, the company said it expected a 1997 net profit of at least 3.5 billion francs ($604.5 million). ($ = 5.789 French Francs)
